weather_report:
As twilight descends upon Downtown San Francisco, the city is enveloped in an almost somber embrace of rain and chill. The air is thick with moisture, glistening in the streetlights' glow as raindrops tap insistently against the window panes. Expect continued showers tonight, with gusts from the south stirring the dampness into a symphony of sound. The atmosphere feels heavy yet alive, signifying a winter's night that urges retreat into warmth—perhaps a cozy corner of a local café or a cherished nook in your home, holding tight to a mug of something warm.

Tomorrow promises more of the same. Beneath a blanket of clouds, temperatures will dip, wrapping the day in a chilly grip. The rain will persist, accumulating like whispered secrets on the pavement. The chance of precipitation looms at 100%, inviting a moment of reflection at home rather than venturing out into the inclement weather. If you must navigate the day, dress warmly in layers—choose a waterproof jacket, comfortable boots to traverse slick sidewalks, and perhaps a well-loved scarf to ward off the lingering chill. In the embrace of the rain, the city may appear awash with color if one stops to take in the reflections on the cobblestone streets and hidden corners. Whether it be the hum of conversations at a local bistro or the soft sound of raindrops creating a rhythm against your umbrella, the experience of this weather is anything but dull; rather, it invites connection and contemplation in its moisture-laden air.
